# Metric Construction


## Definition & Interpretation


$$Debt \: to \: Equity \: Ratio = \frac{Total \: Debt}{Unrestricted \: Net \: Assets} $$

Debt to Equity Ratio is a a leverage ratio that defines the total amount of debt relative to the unrestricted assets owned by an organization. 

This metric measures how much the organization is relying on funding from others. Higher values mean it is more highly leveraged, meaning it has low capacity for future borrowing. As an example: if an organization has a total-debt-to-net-assets ratio of 0.4, 40% of its assets are financed by creditors, and 60% are its own unrestricted, available equity.

One limitation of this metric is that it does not provide any indication of asset quality or liquidity since it lumps tangible and intangible assets together. 



## Variables 

Note: This data is available only for organizations that file full 990s. [Organizations with revenues <$200,000 and total assets <$500,000 have the option to not file a full 990 and file an EZ instead.]

**Numerator:** Total debt, EOY
<br>
*	On 990: Part X, line 17B
  - SOI PC EXTRACTS: accntspayableend
*	On EZ: Not Available
<br>
**Denominator:** Unrestricted Net Assets, EOY
*	On 990: Part X, line 27B
  -SOI PC EXTRACTS: unrstrctnetasstsend
*	On EZ: Not available
<br>

**Note:** This ratio can be interchanged with total liabilities over total net assets (which should be comparable for EZ filers and full 990 filers), but for Community Development Corporations, the more important metric is unrestricted net assets, which isn't available for EZ filers.




```{r, eval=T}
total_debt <- ( core$accntspayableend )

# can't divide by zero
unrs_net_assets <- (core$unrstrctnetasstsend )
unrs_net_assets[ unrs_net_assets == 0 ] <- NA


core$der <- ( total_debt / unrs_net_assets )                     
# summary( core$der )
```


## Standardize Scales

Check high and low values to see what makes sense. 

```{r, fig.height=4}
x.05 <- quantile( core$der, 0.05, na.rm=T )
x.95 <- quantile( core$der, 0.95, na.rm=T )

ggplot( core, aes(x = der ) ) +  
  geom_density( alpha = 0.5) + 
  xlim( x.05, x.95 ) 
```




```{r}
core2 <- core

# proportion of values that are negative
mean( core2$der < 0, na.rm=T ) 
core2$der[ core2$der < 0 ] <- 0

# proption of values above 1% 
mean( core2$der > 5, na.rm=T ) 
core2$der[ core2$der > 5 ] <- 5
```



## Metric Scope


Tax data is available for full 990 filers, so this metric does not describe any organizations with Gross receipts < $200,000 and
Total assets < $500,000. Some organizations with receipts or assets below those thresholds may have filed a full 990, but these would be exceptions.

# Descriptive Statistics


Convert all monetary variables to thousands of dollars. 

```{r, results="asis"}

core2 %>%
  mutate( # der = der * 10000,
    totrevenue = totrevenue / 1000,
    totfuncexpns = totfuncexpns / 1000, 
    lndbldgsequipend = lndbldgsequipend / 1000,
    totassetsend = totassetsend / 1000,
    totliabend = totliabend / 1000,
    totnetassetend = totnetassetend / 1000 ) %>% 
  select( STATE,  NTEE1, NTMAJ12, 
          der, 
          AGE, 
          totrevenue, totfuncexpns, 
          lndbldgsequipend, totassetsend, 
          totnetassetend, totliabend ) %>%

  stargazer( type = s.type, 
             digits=0, 
             summary.stat = c("min","p25","median",
                              "mean","p75","max", "sd"),
             covariate.labels = c("Debt Equity Ratio", "Age", 
                                  "Revenue ($1k)", "Expenses($1k)", 
                                  "Buildings ($1k)", "Total Assets ($1k)",
                                  "Net Assets ($1k)", "Liabiliies ($1k)"))
```



What proportion of orgs have Debt Equity Ratios equal to zero (no debt or payables)?


```{r}
prop.zero <- mean( core2$der == 0, na.rm=T )
```


In the sample, `r 100*round(prop.zero,2)` percent of the organizations have debt equity ratios equal to zero, meaning they have no debt. These organizations are dropped from subsequent graphs to keep the visualizations clean. The interpretation of the graphics should be the distributions of debt equity ratios for organizations that carry at least $1 of debt. 



```{r}
###
### ADD QUANTILES
###
###   function create_quantiles() defined in r-functions.R

core2$exp.q   <- create_quantiles( var=core2$totfuncexpns,   n.groups=5 )
core2$rev.q   <- create_quantiles( var=core2$totrevenue,     n.groups=5 )
core2$asset.q <- create_quantiles( var=core2$totnetassetend, n.groups=5 )
core2$age.q   <- create_quantiles( var=core2$AGE,            n.groups=5 )
```
